alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:03AM EST until December 19 at 3:14AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Washington. In northeast Vermont, Caledonia. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 AM EST, The public reported heavy rain in the warned area with a wash out reported on Flagg Pond Road in Stannard. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyndon, Stannard, Walden, Wheelock, Danville, Cabot, Greensboro, Cabot Village, Sheffield, Peacham, Glover, North Walden, West Danville, South Wheelock, South Walden and East Cabot. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
